item.title: New York State Pavilion Virtual Experience Center, Queens NY
item.dc:creator: ankitdarda
item.description: Project details: Project Type: Idea Competition 2016 Role: Design Proposal Location: Queens, New York Organizer: National Trust for Historic Preservation, https://contest.savingplaces.org/ Software: Sketchup, Photoshop Project description: The challenge of the idea competition was to repurpose the abandoned New York State Pavilion at Flushing Meadow Park in Queens, New York. It was originally designed by Architect Philip Johnson for a […]
item.content:encoded:
Project details:

Project Type: Idea Competition 2016
Role: Design Proposal
Location: Queens, New York
Organizer: National Trust for Historic Preservation, https://contest.savingplaces.org/
Software: Sketchup, Photoshop

Project description:

The challenge of the idea competition was to repurpose the abandoned New York State Pavilion at Flushing Meadow Park in Queens, New York. It was originally designed by Architect Philip Johnson for a celebration of New York World’s Fair in the year 1964. The National Trust for Historic Preservation has organized the idea competition to initiate the preservation opportunities and rejuvenate the park by repurposing the pavilion.

The Flushing Meadows park has enriched strong past; diverse recreational present combining art, science, zoo, and stadium; and will Inspire future through the proposed Virtual Experience Center. It will not only connect the past and future experiences but will also serve as an open repository for Future Virtual Experimentation. Tent for Tomorrow, a multi-user virtual interactive experience will attract every age to witness the 1964’s Worlds Fair as well simultaneously allow 2064’s cities with the user-specific environment. The Entire Pavilion can be digitally restored to original state from glass roof to the floor ready to interact. The program will include the central tent of tomorrow as green virtual experience dome, physical exhibits with digital interaction, educational and arcade game arena, retail and tower top as virtual environment dining. Furthermore, about educational program, you may be interested in Scholarship letter contest. Visit scholarship-positions.com now to read the mechanics.

Perspective Sectional View through Tent of Tomorrow

Virtual Dining Experience inside Tower

Floor Plan Layout

Submitted Competition Board

Featured inside Popular Science Blog

item.title: NOAA Coastal Resilience Grant Proposal 2015
item.dc:creator: ankitdarda
item.description: Project details: Project Type: Academic Role: Design Proposal Location: Hilton Head, South Carolina Software: Sketchup, Photoshop Project description: The challenge of the NOAA Coastal Resilience Grant Proposal was to design and build a structure that will be storm surge, sea level rise responsive, and Climate Change resistant within budget. It envision the prototype using 40 ft. shipping containers […]
item.content:encoded:
Project details:

Project Type: Academic
Role: Design Proposal
Location: Hilton Head, South Carolina
Software: Sketchup, Photoshop

Project description:

The challenge of the NOAA Coastal Resilience Grant Proposal was to design and build a structure that will be storm surge, sea level rise responsive, and Climate Change resistant within budget. It envision the prototype using 40 ft. shipping containers as the base for the design program assembled by the Steel Sectional Grid which can be reinstalled at different coastal region and can withstand severe conditions. The program includes the Storm surge food storage, kitchen, and large gathering spaces.

Entrance side view to the prototype

View showing top dinning space extending to open outdoor gallery

View showing bottom gathering space extending into semi open space

Prototype Elevations

item.title: The Outdoor Savannah: Shipping Container II
item.dc:creator: ankitdarda
item.description: Project details: Project Type: Professional Role: Project Architect Office: Southern Pine Company Client: Blowing Smoke Restaurant, Savannah Location: Savannah, Georgia Software: Sketchup, CAD, Photoshop Project description: Collaborative up-cycled Shipping Container Design experimentation for outdoor restaurant space to hold bar and performance space for local artists and celebrations. The alignment of the Shipping Container is made in such a way that it will allow […]
item.content:encoded:
Project details:

Project Type: Professional
Role: Project Architect
Office: Southern Pine Company
Client: Blowing Smoke Restaurant, Savannah
Location: Savannah, Georgia
Software: Sketchup, CAD, Photoshop

Project description:

Collaborative up-cycled Shipping Container Design experimentation for outdoor restaurant space to hold bar and performance space for local artists and celebrations. The alignment of the Shipping Container is made in such a way that it will allow maximum visual connection with the outdoor-indoor restaurant space and also with the adjoining  street passer-by. It will continue to withhold the Savannah’s outdoor lively spirit while enjoying the southern gourmet at Blowing Smoke Restaurant.

The overall prototype includes three Reclaimed Shipping Containers with Reclaimed Southern Pine Flooring and Bar-Top. The furniture has been provided by the owner and for the other office chair and desk, check out LA Furniture Store. The prototype is attached with the existing building to minimize the cost of existing liquor license in Savannah and still have ability to expand and open with outdoor. The entire prototype suppose to be assembled with storm proof double layered windows with sheet roofing insulation to protect from extreme weather conditions across Savannah. For more details about this design, you can check out Roofco Roofing Company.

Habersham St. Elevation

View from Bar Interior

View from Entrance to Restaurant

Drawings

Sectional Axonometric View

Existing Site Condition

Existing Site Condition

Existing Site – Bird Eye View

item.title: Bamiyan Cultural Centre Design Competition
item.dc:creator: ankitdarda
item.description: Project details: Project Title: Bamiyan Cultural Centre Design Project Type: Competition Competition Organizer: UNESCO, Kabul Office Location: Bamiyan Afghanistan Team: Ankit Darda, Astha Panchal Software: Sketchup, CAD, Photoshop Project description: Bamiyan Cultural Centre – can indeed be people’s centre nourishing cultural excellence. The centre adapts the language of USED SPACES. It acts as a vehicle to further […]
item.content:encoded:
Project details:

Project Title: Bamiyan Cultural Centre Design
Project Type: Competition
Competition Organizer: UNESCO, Kabul Office
Location: Bamiyan Afghanistan
Team: Ankit Darda, Astha Panchal
Software: Sketchup, CAD, Photoshop

Project description:

Bamiyan Cultural Centre – can indeed be people’s centre nourishing cultural excellence. The centre adapts the language of USED SPACES. It acts as a vehicle to further augment the traditional skills. It extracts insight from vernacular forms observed in Bamiyan OLD BAZAAR, SHRINES, Buddhist caves, clusters of fortified-perforated wall, circumambulation paths, attached rectangular annex buildings as observed in Qal’a-i- Kafari A and B, general division in 3 three levels, courtyards etc. Based on the brief and studying the range of societal issues, architectural interpretation of vernacular forms has led to pluralism of USED space- An attribute similar to Bamiyan lifestyle. Shedding the elitist attitude, the designed spaces celebrate the popular- traditional and relevant adaptation seen in the city in last few decades- making it PEOPLE’S CENTRE that nourishes the culture, fostering cross- cultural awareness and broader goals of peace building and reconciliation.

Winter Entrance View to Bamiyan Cultural Center

Competition Panel – I

Competition Panel – II

Competition Panel – III

If there’s a need for moving companies, 9kilo.com is always ready to help. Allow maximum visibility, promotion of the brand and display area for coffee products. item.title: Contemporary Containers: Design Welcome Competition
item.dc:creator: ankitdarda
item.description: Project details: Project Title: Contemporary Containers Project Type: Competition Status: On-Going Client: Art Verona, Italy Location: Verona, Italy Software: Sketchup, CAD, Photoshop Project description: Shipping Containers are the global contemporary heritage space holder available abundantly and circulated widely all across the world. Many of them sent to dumping yard as soon as their primary purpose is served. These […]
item.content:encoded:
Project details:

Project Title: Contemporary Containers
Project Type: Competition
Status: On-Going
Client: Art Verona, Italy
Location: Verona, Italy
Software: Sketchup, CAD, Photoshop

Project description:

Shipping Containers are the global contemporary heritage space holder available abundantly and circulated widely all across the world. Many of them sent to dumping yard as soon as their primary purpose is served. These reclaimable eco-sustainable building blocks can be up-cycled actively for the next urban furnishing module promoting the sustainability inside art, architecture and design culture.

Values: The value Reclaimed Containers promotes is not limited to being Contemporary use but it also tells the story of our globalized ideas made possible through Containers. Now it’s time to re-invent the story in innovative and sustainable way to adopt at varying scale within Urban and Art Verona site context which is highly compliments with the use of Containers.

Deliverables: The reclaimed container could be the cheapest, renewable, and durable material available glocally which can be re-interrogated to achieve temporary-to-permanent adaptation. The flexibility to use number of blocks at a time could relate to the cost of installation, which can be achieved within the constraint of twenty thousand Euro budget or less.

Contemporary Containers – I

 

Contemporary Containers – II

Contemporary Containers – III

Contemporary Containers – IV

Contemporary Containers – V

item.title: Nelson Mandela Memorial Design Competition
item.dc:creator: ankitdarda
item.description: Project details: Project Type: Idea Competition Status: On-Going Client: Nelson Mandela Foundation Location: Skylawn Memorial Park, Santa Cruz Mountain Range, California Software: Sketchup, CAD, Photoshop Project description: The Nelson Mandela Memorial, a tribute of remembrance and honor to Nelson Mandela‘s lifetime struggle for freedom and social justice and an inspiration to us all, will be an emblem for […]
item.content:encoded:
Project details:

Project Type: Idea Competition
Status: On-Going
Client: Nelson Mandela Foundation
Location: Skylawn Memorial Park, Santa Cruz Mountain Range, California
Software: Sketchup, CAD, Photoshop

Project description:

The Nelson Mandela Memorial, a tribute of remembrance and honor to Nelson Mandela‘s lifetime struggle for freedom and social justice and an inspiration to us all, will be an emblem for the local and global circumstances that enlightens visitors more towards the sensory experience. An experience that engages and informs the spirit of the event being commemorated to the visitors; and inspires them to learn more about Nelson Mandela’s contribution to humanity and noble peace. The unrestrained views of the memorial create an ideal setting that promotes unity and diversity.

Nelson Mandela Memorial – I

Nelson Mandela Memorial – II

Nelson Mandela Memorial – III

item.title: Collective Housing: Layered Density
item.dc:creator: ankitdarda
item.description: Project details: Project Type: Academic Class: Graduate Thesis Studio | Spring 2014 Professor: Judith Reno Location: Jacksonville, Florida Software: Revit, 3ds-Max, Photoshop Project description: The design thesis investigates the present foreclosure causes and effects on American Housing and approach Jacksonville, Florida among one of the top foreclosed crisis areas to develop the Collective Housing prototype. […]
item.content:encoded:
Project details:

Project Type: Academic
Class: Graduate Thesis Studio | Spring 2014
Professor: Judith Reno
Location: Jacksonville, Florida
Software: Revit, 3ds-Max, Photoshop

Project description:

The design thesis investigates the present foreclosure causes and effects on American Housing and approach Jacksonville, Florida among one of the top foreclosed crisis areas to develop the Collective Housing prototype.

The concept was to layered the diverse activities and density across the site vertically according the public-private use. Also, promote pedestrian friendly environment and public transit through the proposal by emphases on typological to topological growth. Create a collective community spaces within the proposal and enrich with diverse connections and values through different levels and scale.

View Connecting different levels from Restaurants, Residential Units and Other Public Activites

Professor: Scott Dietz

Project description:

The Objective of the assignment was to explore Increment and Recursive strategies as elements of parametric design as they relate to form, surface, and structure. The Project approached the Hypothetical Contoured site to create a Ground Scraper across the levels at different Scale and level of enclosure.The concept is derived from the natural trees as habitat and horizontal system with support of chop sticks like structural member.

item.title: Digital Fabrication and Prototyping
item.dc:creator: ankitdarda
item.description: Project Details: Type: Academic Class: ELDS 745 | Spring 2013 Professor: Ryan Bacha Software: Rhinoceros, Grasshopper, CAD, Illustrator Materials: 3-axis CNC Machine, Laser Machine, High-Density Foam Project Description: The course examined the fundamental principles of advanced digital prototyping and fabrication methods like Contouring, Folding, Paneling, Corbelling, and Cross-Sectioning forming for architecture and building design. It focuses on the inherent value of […]
item.content:encoded:
Project Details:

Type: Academic
Class: ELDS 745 | Spring 2013
Professor: Ryan Bacha
Software: Rhinoceros, Grasshopper,
CAD, Illustrator
Materials: 3-axis CNC Machine,
Laser Machine, High-Density Foam

Project Description:

The course examined the fundamental principles of advanced digital prototyping and fabrication methods like Contouring, Folding, Paneling, Corbelling, and Cross-Sectioning forming for architecture and building design. It focuses on the inherent value of digital prototypes to evaluate the viability and performance of the design intent with respect to material selection, methods, and the implications of assembly to document the fabrication process.

Paneling Tool Based Fabrication

item.title: Envisioning Victory Drive, Savannah
item.dc:creator: ankitdarda
item.description: Project details: Project Type: Academic Collaboration Class: HIPR Revitalizing Downtown | Winter 2013 Professor: Jong Lim Location: Victory Drive, Savannah Team: Ankit Darda, Andrew Webb, Emily Ouellette Software: Photoshop, Illustrator, In-design Project description: The course has initialized with the analysis and holistic development of the Downtown Revitalization with the Main Street Four Point Approach that […]
item.content:encoded:
Project details:

Project Type: Academic Collaboration
Class: HIPR Revitalizing Downtown | Winter 2013
Professor: Jong Lim
Location: Victory Drive, Savannah
Team: Ankit Darda, Andrew Webb, Emily Ouellette
Software: Photoshop, Illustrator, In-design

Project description:

The course has initialized with the analysis and holistic development of the Downtown Revitalization with the Main Street Four Point Approach that combines organization, design, promotion, and economic restructuring to accomplish sustainable revitalization of downtown’s.Later, The Project approached the Historic Corridor Victory Drive, Savannah concerning the loss of trees, historic resources, quality of life, and overall loss of character and pride. Through survey and analysis, areas of opportunity will be identified to explore community rehabilitation strategies. The Project Objectives include the Reorganizing the Local Community, Community Oriented Development and Creating multi-diverse Connections across the Corridor.

Victory Drive Evolution

The studio required to develop conceptual for the new architecture residential campus design for School of Planning and Architecture, New Delhi. Respond towards the existing local ecology and bio-diverse climate conscious design. the process should not only enrich the existing environment experience but also gives an opportunity to educate the students of architecture and design at each and every level of their involvement on campus. The process explored different passive energy-efficient methods and promote pedestrian friendly access everywhere on design.

item.title: Encountering the Urban Position, HAAF Savannah
item.dc:creator: ankitdarda
item.description: Project details: Class: Graduate Studio | Fall 2012 Professor: Hgu Ngo Team: Ankit Darda, Sahil Das, Chao Zhong Location: HAAF, Savannah Project Area: 244,500 Sq.Ft. Software: Sketchup, Photoshop, Illustrator, CAD Project description: The studio offered a rare introduction to urban design and architecture that emphasized the development of conceptual and representational tools capable of addressing the complexity and variety […]
item.content:encoded:
Project details:

Class: Graduate Studio | Fall 2012
Professor: Hgu Ngo
Team: Ankit Darda, Sahil Das, Chao Zhong
Location: HAAF, Savannah
Project Area: 244,500 Sq.Ft.
Software: Sketchup, Photoshop, Illustrator, CAD

Project description:

The studio offered a rare introduction to urban design and architecture that emphasized the development of conceptual and representational tools capable of addressing the complexity and variety of hybrid traditional and contemporary cities. The project approached the former “Hunter Army Airfield (HAAF)” site in Savannah as a collection of diverse urban conditions. Neighborhood Design developed on diverse recombinant systems of architecture and generative transect urbanity to encounter the Urban Position.The Project has been selected for the NAAB Certification Review and displayed at Department of Architecture SCAD, Savannah.

item.title: Narrow-Gauge Railway Heritage Park, Vadodara India
item.dc:creator: ankitdarda
item.description: Project Details: Project Type: Professional Status: Built, Aug’10 – Jan’11 Project Area: 129,200 Sq.Ft. Role: Project Architect Client: Western Railways, Vadodara Team: Ankit Darda, Astha Panchal Devanshi Purohit Location: Pratapnagar, Vadodara Software: Sketchup, CAD, Photoshop Project description: An initiative to ‘conserve’ and ‘popularize’ the local history of narrow-gauge railways, which has been designed consciously considering the ‘economy’ and ‘ecology’ […]
item.content:encoded:
Project Details:

Project Type: Professional
Status: Built, Aug’10 – Jan’11
Project Area: 129,200 Sq.Ft.
Role: Project Architect
Client: Western Railways, Vadodara
Team: Ankit Darda, Astha Panchal Devanshi Purohit
Location: Pratapnagar, Vadodara
Software: Sketchup, CAD, Photoshop

Project description:

An initiative to ‘conserve’ and ‘popularize’ the local history of narrow-gauge railways, which has been designed consciously considering the ‘economy’ and ‘ecology’ friendly is achieved by re-using the junk Railway material to evoke a sense of our proud Heritage values for now and for the future conceptualized the Idea of Narrow-Gauge Railway Heritage Park.The Project has received Appreciation Certificate from Indian Railways and Special Mention Award for Young Designer of the Year’ 2014 by Indian Architects and Builders Magazine under Urban Design Category for year 2014.

Reinterpreting architecture with the dynamic nature of flamenco dance composition and rhythm. The resulting fabric […]
item.content:encoded:
Project details:

Project Type: Academic
Class: Graduate Studio | Spring 2013
Professor: Carole Pacheco
Location: Jacksonville, Florida
Site Area: 100,000 SQ.FT.
Software: Sketchup, Vray, Photoshop

Project description:

The design challenge was to concomitant the essence of flamenco dance influencing the architectural process and form making. Reinterpreting architecture with the dynamic nature of flamenco dance composition and rhythm. The resulting fabric in return rejuvenate the city of Jacksonville with flamenco dance art.The Program includes Flamenco School, Museum and Black Box Theater as major activities across the site with supporting Public performance spaces.
